post.summary: Execute report and fetch serving data
post.description:
This API runs a report and retrieves the corresponding served data. **Request Body Description:** | **Filed** | **Type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | id | Integer | [Optional] - This is report Id, report data will be fetched for this report id. | | dimensions | JSON String | [Optional] - JSON string representing dimension details. | | columns | Array of String | [Optional] - Metrics for showing serving result | | customerIds | Array of Integer | [Optional] - Customer IDs, report data will be fetched for these customers. | | filters | JSON String | [Optional] - JSON string supporting campaignId, creativeTypeId and campaignStatus filtering. | | searchField | String | [Optional] - Search field for report serving data. | | requestType | Integer | [Optional] - ID to identify if report request is of Daily or Aggregate.
sample : [1- Daily, 2- Aggregated] | | reportAggregated | String | [Optional] - Field to identify if report dimension is Aggregated or not.
sample : [0- Not aggregated, 1- Aggregated] | | startDate | Long | [Optional] - This should be a long, TIME EPOCH in UNIX format, in milliseconds.
This is report start time.| | endDate | Long | [Optional] - This should be a long, TIME EPOCH in UNIX format, in milliseconds.
This is report end time.| | timezoneId | Integer | [Optional] - Timezone ID| | timezoneName | String | [Optional] - Timezone Name| | sortBy | String | [Optional] - Sort the result set by specific field. For ascending use plus(asc) and for descending use minus(desc) string.
Default value is '+impressions'| | pageNo | Integer | [Optional] - Page number for the required data.
Default value is 1| | noOfEntries | Integer | [Optional] - The maximum number of returned results per page.
Default value is 50|

errorObjects.error: Please select columns for report creation

post.description:
This API saves the report scheduling event. **Request Body Description:** | **Filed** | **Type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | reportId | Integer | [Required] - This is report Id, event will be created on this report id. | | subscriberEmails | Array of String | [Required] - List of the emails on which the report will be sent. | | fileType | Integer | [Required] - Report file type id. The report will be sent in the selected file format .
sample : [1 - CSV, 2 - XLS]| | deliveryFrequency | Integer | [Required] - Delivery frequency type id for the emails to be sent.
sample : [1 - ONCE, 2 - DAILY, 3 - WEEKLY, 4 - MONTHLY] | | deliveryDay | String | [Required, if deliveryFrequency is not ONCE] - Delivery day to specify the day-time when the report should be sent.
This is related to Delivery frequency.
WEEKLY DELIVERY DAY: ["SUNDAY", "MONDAY", ...]
MONTHLY DELIVERY DAY: ["FIRST", "LAST", "2", "3", ..., "29"]| | eventEndDate | Long | [Required, if deliveryFrequency is not ONCE] - This should be a long, TIME EPOCH in UNIX format, in milliseconds.
This is events end date, Scheduled report will be stopped after the eventEndDate is exceeded | | runningTotalEnabled | Boolean | [Optional] - Flag to indicate if the 'Total' Running is enabled for the report. This flag is supported only with 'Campaign' dimension.
If this is true the start-date for the report duration should be the EARLIEST campaign start date,
so the report-time-period will be from the Earliest-campaign-start-date to the report-end-date | | earliestCampaignStartDate | Long | [Required with runningTotalEnabled as 'true'] - This should be a long, TIME EPOCH in UNIX format, in milliseconds.
This is campaign's EARLIEST start date from the selected campaigns, which will be set as the start date of the report-time-period. |

data.message: Report schedule has been successfully updated.
Report schedule has been successfully updated.

errorObjects.reason: One or more subscribers emails are empty or not provided as per the email format

patch.description:
This API update the report scheduling event. Whichever field is to be updated, that can be sent in the request body. **Request Body Description:** | **Filed** | **Type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | subscriberEmails | Array of String | List of the emails on which the report will be sent. | | fileType | Integer | Report file type id. The report will be sent in the selected file format.
sample : [1 - CSV, 2 - XLS]| | deliveryFrequency | Integer | Delivery frequency type id for the emails to be sent.
sample : [1 - ONCE, 2 - DAILY, 3 - WEEKLY, 4 - MONTHLY] | | deliveryDay | String | [Required, if deliveryFrequency is not ONCE] - Delivery day to specify the day-time when the report should be sent.
This is related to Delivery frequency.
WEEKLY DELIVERY DAY: ["SUNDAY", "MONDAY", ...]
MONTHLY DELIVERY DAY: ["FIRST", "LAST", "2", "3", ..., "29"]| | eventEndDate | Long | [Required, if deliveryFrequency updated and is not ONCE] - This should be a long, TIME EPOCH in UNIX format, in milliseconds.
This is events end date, Scheduled report will be stopped after the eventEndDate is exceeded | | runningTotalEnabled | Boolean | [Optional] - Flag to indicate if the 'Total' Running is enabled for the report. This flag is supported only with 'Campaign' dimension.
If this is true the start-date for the report duration should be the EARLIEST campaign start date,
so the report-time-period will be from the Earliest-campaign-start-date to the report-end-date | | earliestCampaignStartDate | Long | [Required with runningTotalEnabled as 'true'] - This should be a long, TIME EPOCH in UNIX format, in milliseconds.
This is campaign's EARLIEST start date from the selected campaigns, which will be set as the start date of the report-time-period. |

data.message: Report schedule has been successfully updated.

errorObjects.error: Invalid email provided - invalid Emails : [sample_email1@invalid, sample_email2@invalid].

get.description: This API fetches list of reports as per the given filters

parameters.name: customerIds
parameters.description: Comma separated Customer Ids for filtering. Passing `all` will fetch all eligible customer's report. Default value is `all`

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Response will be sorted on the given field. Allowed sorting values needs to be specified with `-` and `+` prefix.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit defines the number of records returned in the response.

parameters.name: pageNo
parameters.description: Page number defines which page entries will be fetched in response. Pagination will not be applied with value -1

post.description:
This API fetches list of reports as per the given filters **Request Body Description:** | **Filed** | **Type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | customerIds | String | [Optional] - Comma separated String of Customer IDs for which Report's list is requested. Default value is `all` | | searchField | String | [Optional] - Search field for report listing data. Search is supported for Report ID and Report name | | sortBy | String | [Optional] - Sort the result set by specific field. For ascending use plus(asc) and for descending use minus(desc) string.
Default value is `-modifyDate`| | pageNo | Integer | [Optional] - Page number for the required data.
Default value is `1`| | noOfEntries | Integer | [Optional] - The maximum number of returned results per page.
Default value is `20`|

earliestCampaignStartDate.description: Earliest start date from selected Campaigns (required when runningTotalEnabled = true)

deliveryFrequency.description: Delivery Frequency: 1 = once ; 2 = daily ; 3 = weekly ; 4 = monthly

eventEndDate.description: Unix epoch timestamp in milliseconds of event End Date (required if deliveryFrequency = 2,3,4)

startDate.description: Start date of the report, unix epoch timestamp

endDate.description: End date of the report, unix epoch timestamp

dimensions.description: Dimensions to filter by. JSON-serialized array of objects, each with a mandatory `filter` and optional `value` array. Example JSON (before stringifying): [{"filter":"campaign"},{"filter":"gender","value":[10200002]}]

customerIds.description: List of customer IDs associated with the report

items.description: List of customer IDs associated with the report

columns.description: List of columns to be included in the report

items.description: List of columns to be included in the report

timezoneId.description: ID of the timezone for the report: 29=eastern

owId.description: Ow ID associated with the report

timezoneName.description: Timezone name. Keep as "US/Eastern" if not specified otherwise.
